document_data.name: Hades

Description.Niflheim:
{{Main|Niflheim}}
Compared to Oinos, the terrain in the second layer was rougher, like foothills, with cooler temperatures, healthier vegetation including pine trees, and no disease. Everything was cloaked in dreary fog and mist, limiting vision to about a hundred feet (thirty meters). [[Yggdrasil]]'s roots reached Niflheim, connecting it to [[Gladsheim#Asgard|Asgard]] in [[Gladsheim]].
Description.Pluton:
{{Main|Pluton}}
The lowest level of Hades contained the base of [[Mount Olympus]], a direct conduit through the [[Astral Plane]] to the plane of [[Arborea]]. The gray motif continued throughout this layer but most of the vegetation was black willow trees and dry, dying poplars.

document_data.Inhabitants:
* [[Abbathor]], the dwarven Great Master of Greed had a realm in Hades called the ''[[Glitterhell]]'' because it was lined with gold that sparkled even in the gloom.
* [[Anthraxus]] the Decayed was the most powerful daemon in the [[Lower Planes]], occupying his mighty fortress the [[Khin-Oin]], or Wasting Tower—a twenty mile (32 km) high citadel with dungeons that went just as deep underground.
* [[Cegilune]], the goddess of the [[hag]]s, kept her realm of [[Hagsend]] in Pluton.<ref> 
* [[Cyric]], the Dark Sun, after the [[Time of Troubles]] took over the portfolios of [[Bane]], [[Bhaal]], and [[Myrkul]] and set up a realm in Hades.
* Hades of the [[Greek pantheon]] had a realm in Pluton where the gates were guarded by the three-headed dog Cerberus.
* Hel from the [[Norse pantheon]] was the ruler of Niflheim where she guarded the dead.
* [[Hecate]], the Greek interloper deity of magic and the moon, had her primary realm called [[Aeaea]] in Pluton.<ref>
* [[Jergal]] formed his realm, [[Bone Castle]], in Oinos when he was the Lord of the Dead.<ref> He remained there as servant of Myrkul and Cyric, and became Seneschal of the Crystal Spire under Kelemvor.<ref>
* [[Kalzareinad]], [[Draconic pantheon|draconic demigod]] of evil magic, resided in the Gray Waste before his demise during the Time of Troubles.<ref>
* [[Kelemvor]] took over the realm of his predecessors in Oinos and transformed it into the [[Crystal Spire]].
* [[Kuraulyek]], god of the [[urd]]s, hid in his realm of [[Urdsrest]] among the hills of Oinos from [[Kurtulmak]].<ref>
* [[Mask]], the Lord of Shadows once lived here in [[Shadow Keep]], dressed in colorful clothes but also a gray cloak.
* [[Myrkul]], Lord of Bones lived with his [[skeleton]]s, [[zombie]]s, and minor Deaths in the [[Bone Castle|Castle of Bones]].
* [[Nergal (deity)|Nergal]] the [[Untheric pantheon|Untheric]] (and Babylonian) god of the dead ruled a large part of Oinos from his circular city of seven concentric domes, [[Nergaltos]]. There he kept the prisoners [[Marduk]] brought to him.
* [[Nidhogg]], a huge, very ancient [[red dragon]] and her brood occupied (and consumed) the roots of [[Yggdrasil]] the World Ash, trying to break the conduit to Asgard.
* [[Shar]], Mistress of the Night kept her [[Palace of Loss]] in Niflheim.
* [[Yurtrus]] the White Handed, orcish god of death and disease lived in Hades on the layer of Oinos, in his realm called [[Fleshslough]].<ref>
